result.execSummary:
All charges against Steven Joseph Schafer in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven Joseph Schafer is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Joseph Schafer

Notice of Intent to Introduce Defendant's Statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim K.T., C.T or any siblings(person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven Joseph Schafer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Steven Joseph Schafer. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
